title: @RiotTryndamere ( MarcMerrill) Please read this from a player who loves your game
body:
As some one who loves playing League, a player, a top lane main, a customer that buys RP, I ask you to step in to solve the problem between us (people who plays league) and your game balance team (Meddler and his team).

We as players who mained Top lane, are struggling since 5 months, tanks are being too strong, {{item:3076}} exist and it's not fun at all to fight a tank at min 7 with this item where you only might have {{item:1053}}, junglers camping top easily, and if the enemy top laner got one kill you can't come back in lane, he will freeze and you will lose everything if your jungler was premade with bot/mid, or if he refused to come gank you it's over. 

Right now on twitch.tv all the top mains have quit streaming, Dyrus not streaming as he used to, Quas not streaming the same he used to, top laners left the lane and started playing jungle even SoloRenektonTop, the only one who stayed playing top is Hashinshin and he's struggling.

Your game balance team notice that problem and know about it since a long time, what your employees have done is the continuous ignorance to us, the continuous ignorance to releasing a bruisers keystone to help bruisers in game, we are struggling, we are not having fun anymore, and above all that we are facing ignorance on boards, and we are not finding answers from your Balance team, all what we get is a "quick gameplay thoughts" which only focus on bot lane champs and mid lane with complete ignorance to bruisers or the fact that they worked for 3 years on the new runes and refused to make a bruisers keystone.

Your employees do work on ADC items Mages items, but leaving bruisers with outdated items, to the state that I open LCS today and found {{champion:24}}  being played Jungle with full tank items build, and your balance team sees that it's okay that bruisers are not building their own items, and that those bruisers are buying tanks items, I as a player see that it means that tank items are better than bruisers items on bruisers which let the LCS players to go for tank items, which proves that bruisers items are bad and your balance team despite knowing this fact they are not doing any efforts. 

In the end just wanna request as someone who loves this game, please step in and stop them from making more streamers I love quitting the game, because it will end up that we as players who loved the game and mained top lane,  quit the game until you find that player base are going down dramatically.

Just like Duskblade happened at the end of season 6 and still hasn't been dealt with yet, lol.

It took almost an entire season before a community of about 100 million players realized that Ardent was broken. People only started using it towards the very end of the season, even though it had been exactly the same for a very long time. Can't really expect a team of just tens of devs to discover something before the playerbase does.

And yes, it took several patches afterwards to get it nerfed, but that was a combination of surprise ("Huh, this thing that has been exactly the same for many months is suddenly OP?") and not wanting to nerf the item that made enchanters viable right before Worlds (as there had been a lot of criticism in the past when they shaked up the meta right before Worlds).

There are definitely things you can blame on the balance team, but Censer isn't really one of them.
It didn't take us a season to realize that ardent was broken, we had redemption which was even more broken.

It's a long standing problem in league that blown up this season.

One part I think exacerbated things season 8 is the way defense base stats were handled when old runes got discarded. Fighters require durability to be well fighters and not assassins. All tanks and AD dmg dealers got 9 armor. Many supports got more armor. AP dmg dealers got scaling hp. This is relatively unfavorable for fighters top lane who lane vs. tanks which many deal AP base dmg. Also unfavorable for fighters who as players or in general are expected to build a more offensive item first. And what if they have to lane vs. ranged AP. Because only scaling health was giving out the AP are also fragile though and probably why Rumble isn't a premier pro top laner atm. I wondered if we'd get a double AP meta. Maybe with the AP item update maybe.

I thought armor/hp/magic resist approach was nonsensical because these stats were adaptive before and will obviously throw game off balance w/o that.

Season 8 comes along and now everyone is ultra fragile. I thought this was funny and fun for a while. Though too silly for balance. And thought surely it will be partially reverted adding marginal resistance to every champ, particularly melee. Especially juggernaut. Maybe the goal has been to raise early game danger and lane outplays which has also been needed. But this unequal distribution has caused some side effects. I would have done just the same armor and mr to everyone but perhaps less than the flat amounts available before.

This has caused the effect of making certain meta survival items even more essential. Which is not the direction I would have imagined going. But I understand wanting to keep important and impactful decisions.

Another thing to look at maybe is starting items. I always felt dorans blade was slightly weaker than other starting items, but it looks fine because ranged characters have good laning phases. A melee champ starting this item can easily lose his single potion. And no one stacks DBlades anymore. So what if DBlade was slightly better, either costing 420g with other dorans items with 40g potions or a marginal stat tweak and all typical ranged auto attackers lost like 1 or 2 AD for lane. This would also reduce ranged characters poaching relic shield or dorans shield or even corrupting potion. Also I feel refill potion is clearly way more valuable and that red potions are thought to be too wasteful now. Hence why 40g potions as long as getting kills in lane stays doable. Now tho I'm not sure about all these changes however. I feel like starting items + potions across the board could use a medium scope rework to make them unsolved again as they are very important items interacted with early in the game. I would actually wonder if a future better design for new dorans items would be to make them less stat dependent and say "this is a health dorans item" or "this is a mana dorans item." With like a 3rd or 4th being... gold? Potions (well we has corrupting already)? And Assassin-y (stacking?)? If I wanted to super power them then they would be limited to 1 dorans.

Also I would raise IE cost back up even though zeal upgrades might be OP. The zeals are useful bridges from other builds. Pushing off IE complete time like it used to be would maybe open up early game centric adc item diversity again which gets adc to sorta self regulate.

Also as for playing as AD I feel like they don't get enough choices for their build. I miss when adc were somehow satisfied around 50-55% crit and had one more slot. And getting near 100% crit was weird. I dunno what caused it to change exactly. Actually I have a weird one what if we threw out last whisper and crit was a tank bust stat. Problem with that is IDK if you can call it crit anymore. And IDK if better choices can be presented.

I literally made a post talking about the exact same things.  The issues that people have really come down to losing, 25-35% of their base armor / mr.  All the specific complaints are symptoms of that.  Why are tanks outdamaging fighters? They didnt buff tank damage, you just lost 12 mr from glyphs.

Of course it got downvoted to oblivion.  This community is horrible.  They want to relentlessly complain and when someone says 'Hey I'm pretty sure this is the reason why' you get downvoted into oblivion.

I made a thread about rework Caitlyn waaaay back.  I said her base damage is too high, it's oppressive, no one will want to play against it.  Downvoted to oblivion.  2 months later community raging about how oppressive she is.

I made a thread a few months ago about how Tristana's kit was too versatile.  The kit itself has no inherent weakness.  Downvoted to oblivion.  Look at what the boards do now.

They don't want solutions.  They just want to bitch about something.

The MR loss was huge yeah. Main reason Teemo got so oppressive was that he essentially got the same damage as the buggy Thunderlord via Aery in just one Q>AA trade, and with gutted MR he would take like 1/4 of someone's health.

A lot of these changes are kind of ignored because people don't look under the surface though. I will say that tanks even if they were lackluster in lane right now still have more CC and therefore more impact in a game even if they lose lane simply because damage, an expensive stat, is not their priority outside of a few champs. People tend to forget this over and over.

Sustain has taken HUGE hits as Riot seemingly wants games to be more punishing to the individual for misplaying. Top lane literally lives and breathes off of lane sustain and making comebacks, and it's essentially been killed off in the item department without anyone noticing outside of what? ADC using Doran's sustain way back? It was never addressed ever again, so you need Fleet Footwork or in-kit sustain to do anything, or be the one *always* winning the trades/committing to harass.

For Tristana, she's only good when crit is the main build. Otherwise she gets knocked off and has trouble recovering at all outside of some extreme snowbally cases. Something else overlooked.

All you can keep doing really is keep trying and try to word your posts in a way people can be more open to it, while also leaving yourself open to discussion. I've seen your post and it came off pretty aggressive even though the idea of what you were saying was understandable. Have to be open to others' opinions as much as they have to be open to yours.

Hi Boss. The game is losing the one thing that made me as a player love it. Heart. What I mean is that the game is losing that made it a masterpiece in the first place: the unique passion and drive that made League the Beast it is.

I wouldn't lie and say that I haven't say said some nasty things about Riot on the boards because I've been angry over how things in terms of gameplay experience has become so bad and that people thing It's like, just like that dog with a hat in the burning house. I get pissed over the fact that the dev's can do a better job and I ain't because I want to demand a perfect meta, that can never happen but I always have faith in the dev's at least can make the game as balance as possible. The reason I get mad is because I believe that League can get back on track and regain the essence that lead people to play and love the game from the early seasons. Doing so would make League far better than ever as it combines the the heart with the features that have been added to the game to create a more rich and stable game in spite of gamebreaking champions, items etc. 

There are problems with League and this time it ain't just people complaining because of lousy reasons, but because as players, we are dealing with a crippling balance problem and it has to be dealt with now. Sorry for being so direct about it but something needs to be done. 

Peace out Boss Trynda.

As someone who played for 8 years, mostly top lane, and has now for the most part stopped playing altogether, I want to have faith, but it is hard to when I've been alienated and shit on by your employees. I really hope that you do a complete 360 degrees change in direction because, I mean, like the OP said it has been 5 months. If you want this game to stay alive, you've gotta bring your players back to the game. situation reminds me of dynamic queue. that time it took an entire year for the dumpster fire we had on our hands to be addressed. An entire year. You don't get to do that twice and still have a game.

I love this game, please don't let it end like this.

Just nerf the tanks/tanks build which outscale dmg dealers in top. Also, manage the jungle spawn times - junglers lose nothing for camping a lane right now. That would be a start.

Playing Trynd is really hard right now. The buffs were nothing,  even if he receives 10 AD straight dmg buff it won't help him - too many disruptions in kits recently.

- Snowballing, baron buff is already oppressive and you think of buffing it further. 

- ~20-25 mins is not LATEGAME and it shouldnt be. Minion block, minion pushing - you have a lot on your plate to tweak.

- the balance team is way too slow in their approach.
You have no idea how good it is to hear this instead of the "your wrong I'm right" attitude most rioters gave. (before they recently dissapeared off the face of the map)

I'd just like to comment, though I'm not an expert in any sense of the word, but I think when the changes the balance team does becomes a joke to their co-workers (see LCS commentators about .25s change to Zoe's Q at rank 5) then there might be something fundamentally wrong with the people in charge of gameplay balance.

Side-note: Got a strange idea that every Ryze Rework that happens is due to actual events with Brandon Beck (Ryze) whether he gets reworked when he gets married/has a kid. Just a hunch of mine, but feels like those are the reasons for his "reworks"

LCS commentators are not the balance team's direct coworkers - they are more mirrors of the community that pick up on the community's antics, opinions and memes.

In reality, that nerf did have some impact, due to being larger than 0.25 seconds at ranks 1-4 of the skill, [as evident by about a drop of 1% in Zoe's winrate.](http://champion.gg/champion/Zoe/Middle?league=)
Now, that is not the world, mind you, and she warrants further nerfs, but you cannot say that Q's CD increase had zero impact.

To be fair I think the way most of see jobs as: If you work at the same company, then you're pretty much co-workers despite the positions.

I'm also not saying that Q's CD change had zero impact, I'm saying that if other people who are in the same company as you are forwardly making jokes about your work there is a problem with the work done, more weight is put on that when those who make fun of your work are on equal standings. In this case we'd look at Rank/MMR for both positions in LCS casters and balance teams, where minimum they require you to be atleast Platinum MMR/Rank (roughly top 10% of players)

Funny thing actually, the fact that top lane has little impact on the game is the reason why botlane is more focused by entire teams. If top lane was as important as bot lane, then the top laner could relieve pressure from botlane, but as it stands that's not really how it works right now.

Even outside the top lane problem I feel obligated to point out that you are losing a lot of player trust from the actions of the balance team in the past few years. I used to give them the benefit of the doubt but after watching them fumble after fumble i just can't anymore. I hope you're exploring ways to address that.

Thanks, you don't know how much relieving is to heard this. I'm one of those top lane mains who stopped playing daily to play once every 2 weeks, due to how disconnected i felt from the game when playing top. This sensation really feels terrible, it's like losing one of you best forms of entertainment, the one who followed you for years. I'm sure i'm not the only one who feels like this.

We just want a viable space in the meta; not one out-of-line fighter/bruiser, but all fighters/bruisers (Juggernauts, Divers and Skirmishers).

Please take your time and don't make any knee jerk decisions. Top Lane has had problems since before I joined league (Nocturne release 2011) things have just come to a head publicly recently. I remember when Vlad was the "end of top lane" I remember when the "MetaGolem" build was the go to for all top laners. I've seen almost every single meta the game has ever had and Riot has never been in a better spot to fix long standing issues.
